text:
This CVE was assigned by Chrome.  Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) ingests Chromium, which addresses this vulnerability. Please see [Google Chrome Releases](https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2024) for more information. 
Chromium: CVE-2024-1284 Use after free in Mojo 
On this page 
 
CVE-2024-1284 
Security Vulnerability 
Released: Feb 8, 2024  
Assigning CNA: 
Chrome 
CVE-2024-1284  
 
This CVE was assigned by Chrome.  Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) ingests Chromium, which addresses this vulnerability. Please see  
Google Chrome Releases 
 for more information. 
Why is this Chrome CVE included in the Security Update Guide? 
The vulnerability assigned to this CVE is in Chromium Open Source Software (OSS) which is consumed by Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based). It is being documented in the Security Update Guide to announce that the latest version of Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is no longer vulnerable. 
How can I see the version of the browser? 
In your Microsoft Edge browser, click on the 3 dots (...) on the very right-hand side of the window

metadata.title: Chromium: CVE-2024-1284 Use after free in Mojo
metadata.description: This CVE was assigned by Chrome.  Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) ingests Chromium, which addresses this vulnerability. Please see [Google Chrome Releases](https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2024) for more information.
metadata.summary: Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is affected by a use after free vulnerability in Mojo, identified as CVE-2024-1284. This vulnerability was assigned by Chrome and is addressed by ingesting Chromium. The vulnerability stems from a flaw in the Chromium Open Source Software (OSS) that Microsoft Edge consumes. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code. Microsoft has released security updates for Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) versions 120.0.2210.175 and 121.0.2277.113 to mitigate this issue. System administrators are advised to update their Microsoft Edge installations to the latest versions provided to eliminate the risk of exploitation. For more information, refer to the Google Chrome Releases page.
metadata.nvd_description: use after free in mojo in google chrome prior to 121.0.6167.160 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted html page. (chromium security severity: high)
